content.content:
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "sets"
(
    id               INTEGER           not null
        primary key autoincrement,
    baseSetSize      INTEGER,
    block            TEXT,
    booster          TEXT,
    code             TEXT              not null
        unique,
    isFoilOnly       INTEGER default 0 not null,
    isForeignOnly    INTEGER default 0 not null,
    isNonFoilOnly    INTEGER default 0 not null,
    isOnlineOnly     INTEGER default 0 not null,
    isPartialPreview INTEGER default 0 not null,
    keyruneCode      TEXT,
    mcmId            INTEGER,
    mcmIdExtras      INTEGER,
    mcmName          TEXT,
    mtgoCode         TEXT,
    name             TEXT,
    parentCode       TEXT,
    releaseDate      DATE,
    tcgplayerGroupId INTEGER,
    totalSetSize     INTEGER,
    type             TEXT
);

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/card_games.sqlite" "SELECT code, name FROM sets WHERE name = 'Journey into Nyx Hero''s Path';"
input.description: Find the set code for Journey into Nyx Hero's Path

content.text: Now let me query the cards in this set and find the one with the highest converted mana cost.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/card_games.sqlite" "SELECT name, convertedManaCost FROM cards WHERE setCode = 'THP3' ORDER BY convertedManaCost DESC;"
input.description: Get all cards in the set ordered by converted mana cost

The results are clear:

- **Hall of Triumph** has a converted mana cost of **3.0**, which is the highest in the set.
- All other cards in the "Journey into Nyx Hero's Path" set have a converted mana cost of **0.0**.

The claim states that "Hall of Triumph is the card with the highest converted mana cost" in this set, which is fully supported by the data.
